threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects Python backdoor found on ESXi servers
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
This Python script implements a simple HTTP server that accepts POST requests and executes the commands specified in the request body. The script first checks the value of the `server_namespace` parameter and only executes the request if the value matches a pre-defined hash. The script then checks the value of the `service_instance` parameter and executes the corresponding command. If the `service_instance` parameter is set to `local`, the script executes the command specified in the `operation_id` parameter. If the `service_instance` parameter is set to `remote`, the script executes a command that opens a reverse shell on the specified host and port.

This script is likely to be used as a backdoor to gain remote access to a victim's system. The script is not obfuscated and does not use any anti-analysis techniques. Therefore, it is relatively easy to detect and analyze.
